711243f-a.text:
107, 109, 111 East 14th Street, north side, east of Fourth Avenue.  No. 109, in the center, is old Steinway Hall.

June, 1925

723627f-a.title: Manhattan: Union Square - 14th Street - [Union Square Park.]
723627f-a.text:
Classification: Parks
Union Square, seen from the S.W. corner at University Place and 14th Street, nearly identical in scene with the New York Edison Company's photograph No. 49767, taken in 1893. Most of the new buildings shown here were erected between 1902 and 1910. The new Union Square Savings Bank is on the N.E. corner of 15th Street, and the 11-story Reliance Building at 32 Union Square, adjoins the old building now occupied by the Freiheit. a radical Yiddish paper. To the same period belong the Everett Building on the N.W. corner of 17th Street and Fourth Avenue, and the Guardian Life Insurance building (originally Germania Life Insurance) on the N.E. corner. On the street floor of the old Union Square Hotel may be seen one of the signs of S. Klein's dress emporium. In 193O The Daily Worker, organ of the Communist Party, will be occupying the old building next to the Freiheit, where Elite Styles are shown in this picture; and by 1933 S. Klein will have overflowed into both these buildings. The principal change during these years, however, will be the demolition of the old Westmoreland at 17th Street and of 44 Union Square adjoining, to make room for the new Tammany Hall and Manufacturers Trust Building, and the drastic changes in the park, which in this picture still has much the same general outlines as
it had thirty-five years earlier.
January 11, 1928.
New York Edison Company Collection, (No. 60533).
723627f-a.folder: Union Square & 14th Street & [Union Square Park.], Manhattan, NY

711246f-a.text:
14th Street, north side, east from Fourth Avenue (Union Square):
new Consolidated Gas Building at Irving Place.

August 4, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

711245f-a.text:
101-103 East 14th Street at N.E. corner of Union Square East (Fourth Avenue).

June 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

708188f-a.text:
S. E. corner of Fourth Avenue and 14th Street.
Note Blue Eagle N. R. A. posters in windows;
this was in early days of N. R. A., when it received enthusicaatic, even hysterical, support.
Note also election poster for Tammany ticket in Mayoralty cam-paign.
This photograph was made on Election Day, when a reform ticket was elected.

November 7, 1933.

P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

723607f-a.title: Manhattan: Union Square (East) - 14th Street.
723607f-a.text:
Union Square East, from 8 Union Square (above 14th Street) to 34 Union Square at 16th Street, showing the expansion of S. Klein. The Union Square Hotel is on the S.E. corner of 15th Street and the
Union Square Savings Bank on the N.W. corner.
February 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

723604f-a.title: Manhattan: Union Square (East) - 14th Street.
723604f-a.text:
North on Union Square East, from and including 14th Street, showing only 14th to 15th Streets, due to the curve of Union Square East.  The building under "Greatest Values" is S. Klein's new building, made in 1930 by remodelling old 8 and 10-12 Union Square.

June 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
